Using the Orbit Designer

The Orbit Designer is a tool that allows the user to compute Keplerian elements for the Spacecraft by selected from one of six common orbit types and specifying a minimum number of parameters that allow the rest to be computed. Relevant values are then transfered to the Spacecraft Panel.

Figure 3. Orbit Designer Dialog Window


Orbit Parameters

SMA

Osculating Keplerian semimajor axis in the coordinate system chosen in the Spacecraft Coordinate System field. SMA must be strictly greater than 1 m or less than -1 m to avoid numerical issues in the conversions to other state types.

Type

Real

Orbits

Sun Sync

Default

7000

Limits

6478.1363 < SMA < 8378.1363

Units

km

Mean ALT

Mean altidude above the earth's surface

Type

Real

Orbits

Sun Sync, Frozen

Default

Sun Sync: 621.863699999999880

Frozen: 790

Limits

Sun Sync: 100 < ALT < 2000

Frozen: 0 < ALT

Units

km

ECC

Osculating eccentricity. For circular or elliptic orbits, ECC must be greater than or equal to 0.0, and less than or equal to 0.9999999 to avoid numerical issues in the conversion to other state types as the Keplerian elements are undefined for parabolic orbits.

Type

Real

Orbits

Sun Sync, Repeat Sun Sync, Repeat Ground Track

Default

Sun Sync, Repeat Sun Sync: .001

Repeat Ground Track: 0.00117604

Limits

0<ECC<1

Units

none

INC

Osculating inclination with respect to the selected coordinate system.

Type

Real

Orbits

Sun Sync, Repeat Ground Track, Frozen

Default

Sun Sync: 97.8739286731882600

Repeat Ground Track: 98.2

Frozen: 98.6

Limits

Sun Sync: 90 < INC < 110

Units

deg

RP

Radius of Periapsis

Type

Real

Orbits

Sun Sync

Default

6993

Limits

6478.1363 < RP

Units

km

RA

Radius of Apoapsis

Type

Real

Orbits

Sun Sync

Default

7006.9999999999991

Limits

6478.1363 < RA

Units

km

P

Semi-latus rectum

Type

Real

Orbits

Sun Sync

Default

6999.9929999999995

Limits

0 < P < 8378.1363

Units

km

Days to Repeat

The number of days before the orbit repeats it's ground track.

Type

Real

Orbits

Repeat Sun Sync, Repeat Ground Track

Default

16

Limits

0 < Days to Repeat

Units

days

Revs to Repeat

The number of revolutions for the spacecraft to complete in each repeat cycle.

Type

Real

Orbits

Repeat Sun Sync, Repeat Ground Track

Default

232

Limits

0 < Revs to Repeat

Units

none

Revs per Day

The number of revolutions the spacecraft completes in a day.

Type

Real

Orbits

Repeat Sun Sync, Repeat Ground Track

Default

14.5

Limits

0 < Revs Per Day

Units

none

Epoch Format

The entry format and time system of the Epoch field.

ValueDescription
A1GregorianA.1 time scale, Gregorian format ("DD MMM YYYY hh:mm:ss.ddd")
A1ModJulianA.1 time scale, modified Julian format
TAIGregorianTAI time scale
TAIModJulianDefault
TTGregorianTT time scale
TTModJulian 
UTCGregorianUTC time scale
UTCModJulian 

Epoch

The initial epoch of the spacecraft's state and properties.

Type

String

Orbits

All

Default

01 Jan 2000 11:59:28.000 (UTCGregorian format)

Limits

04 Oct 1957 12:00:00.000 or later in all time systems (6116.0 modified Julian)

Units

days (modified Julian format only)

RAAN

The right ascension of the ascending node of the orbit.

Type

Real

Orbits

Sun Sync, Repeat Sun Sync, Repeat Ground Track, Molniya, Frozen

Default

280.4609834242928100

Limits

0<=RAAN<360

Units

deg

Longitude

The longitude of a spacecraft in geostationary orbit.

Type

Real

Orbits

Geostationary

Default

-79.5390165757071940

Limits

-180<Longitude<=180

Units

deg

Initial Local Sidereal Time

The initial local sidereal time of the ascending node of the spacecraft's orbit.

Type

String

Orbits

All

Default

12:00:00.000

Limits

none

Units

none

Sun Synchronous

The sun synchronous orbit is an orbit that will cross any point on the earth's surface at a constant local mean solar time.

Input Fields

Requires two of: SMA, Mean ALT, ECC, INC, RA, RP, P

Optional Fields

Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Output Fields

SMA, Mean ALT, ECC, INC, RA, RP, P, Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Repeat Sun Synchronous

The repeat sun synchronous orbit is a sun synchronous orbit that will also repeat it's ground track in a given period.

Input Fields

Requires ECC and two of: Days to Repeat, Revs to Repeat, Revs per Day

Optional Fields

Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Output Fields

SMA,Mean ALT, ECC, INC, RA, RP, P, Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Repeat Ground Track

The repeat ground track orbit is an orbit that will, in a given period, pass over the same path on the earth's surface.

Input Fields

Requires ECC, INC and two of: Days to Repeat, Revs to Repeat, Revs per Day

Optional Fields

Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Output Fields

SMA, Mean ALT, ECC, INC, RA, RP, P, Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Geostationary

The geostationary orbit is an equitorial orbit that will maintain constant position with respect to the earth's surface.

Input Fields

Requires no input

Optional Fields

Epoch, Longitude, Initial Local Sidereal time

Output Fields

SMA, Mean ALT, ECC, INC, RA, RP, P, RAAN, AOP, Epoch, TA, Initial Local Sidereal time, Longitude

Molniya

The molniya orbit is a highly eccentric orbit that spends most of it's time above the northern hemisphere.

Input Fields

Requires no input

Optional Fields

Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Output Fields

SMA, Mean ALT, ECC, INC, RA, RP, P, AOP, Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Frozen

The frozen orbit is an orbit that shows very small long term changes in alitude, arguement of perigee, and eccentricity.

Input Fields

Requires Mean ALT and INC

Optional Fields

Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time

Output Fields

SMA, Apogee ALT, Perigee ALT, ECC, Epoch, RAAN, Initial Local Sidereal time
